nodes.text: Ord Lithone was a planet in the Ord Lithone system, part of the Inner Rim. In the years preceding the Clone Wars, it was the site of a Baktoid Armor Workshop droid manufacturing facility. Baktoid left the planet in 22 BBY, intending to move its factories to the Outer Rim Territories.
Ord Lithone was located in the Ord Lithone system of the Inner Rim.

The planet derived its name from the Ordnance/Regional Depots, a series of military outposts established by the Galactic Republic during the Pius Dea Era, chiefly to protect Human colonists from the perceived threat of other sentient species.

In the years leading up to the Clone Wars, the droid manufacturing corporation Baktoid Armor Workshop maintained a B1-Series battle droid factory on the world. In 22 BBY, Baktoid shut down its production facilities on several planets, including Ord Lithone. The corporation cited the forced dissolution of its biggest customer—Trade Federation security forces—as well as Republic economic sanctions on the sale of battle droids as the reason for stopping production; in reality, Baktoid simply moved its factories to the Outer Rim Territories. As a direct result of Baktoid's relocation, twelve million employees—including those on Ord Lithone—lost their jobs.

Ord Lithone was first introduced through an article on the HoloNet News website (2002). Information from this article was repeated in the novel The Cestus Deception (2004), as well as in StarWars.com's Databank entry for the Geonosis droid factory. The Essential Atlas (2009) pinpointed Ord Lithone's location.
